src:
PSSI Pecat Simon McMenemy
06 Nov 2019, 05:59 by Tempo.co, Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Komite Eksekutif PSSI memutuskan untuk mengganti pelatih Timnas Indonesia, Simon McMenemy. Pergantian pelatih tersebut disampaikan langsung oleh Ketua PSSI, Mochamad Iriawan, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
“Kami mengucapkan terima kasih kepada Simon atas kerja sama selama ini. Semoga laga melawan Malaysia kita mendapatkan hasil yang positif,” kata pria yang akrab disapa Iwan Bule ini melalui situs resmi PSSI.
Laga kedua Timnas Indonesia melawan Malaysia di Kualifikasi Piala Dunia 2022 akan menjadi pertandingan terakhir bagi Simon. Federasi saat ini tengah mencari pengganti Simon. Komite Eksekutif akan mendengarkan masukan dari Departemen Teknik PSSI.
Selain itu, federasi juga akan mengundang dan menyerap aspirasi dari beberapa ahli dan pelatih yang ada di Indonesia. “Kami akan mendiskusikan hal ini dengan terbuka,” sebut Iriawan.
Beberapa nama pelatih masuk dalam pantauan, seperti mantan pelatih tim nasional Korea Selatan, Shin Tae Yong. Selain itu juga ada sosok Luis Milla yang kembali diusulkan.
Simon McMenemy mulai menangani Timnas Indonesia pada awal 2019. Pelatih asal Skotlandia ini dikontrak dua tahun hingga 2020 mendatang. Simon telah memimpin Timnas Indonesia sebanyak tujuh kali pertandingan. Tiga laga uji coba internasional (FIFA Match Day) dan empat laga Kualifikasi Piala Dunia 2022.

PSSI
text:
PSSI Fire Simon McMenemy
06 Nov 2019, 05:59 by Tempo.co, Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The PSSI Executive Committee has decided to replace the Indonesian national team coach, Simon McMenemy. The replacement of trainers was delivered directly by the Chairman of PSSI, Mochamad Iriawan, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
"We thank Simon for the cooperation so far. Hopefully the match against Malaysia will get positive results, "said the man who is familiarly called Iwan Bule through the official PSSI website.
The second match of the Indonesian national team against Malaysia in the 2022 World Cup Qualifiers will be the last match for Simon. The Federation is currently looking for Simon's replacement. The Executive Committee will listen to input from the PSSI Engineering Department.
In addition, the federation will also invite and absorb the aspirations of several experts and trainers in Indonesia. "We will discuss this matter openly," said Iriawan.
Some names of coaches entered the monitoring, such as former South Korean national team coach, Shin Tae Yong. In addition there is also the figure of Luis Milla who was again proposed.
Simon McMenemy began handling the Indonesian national team in early 2019. The Scottish coach was contracted two years until 2020. Simon has led the Indonesian national team seven times. Three international test matches (FIFA Match Day) and four World Cup Qualifying matches in 2022.

PSSI
